Legislative History of Laws

For history of Law 18-377, see notes under ยง 22-303.

DC CODE ยง 22-3010.02

Current through December 11, 2012

sections.text: It is unlawful for a person to arrange to engage in a sexual act or sexual contact with an individual (whether real or fictitious) who is or who is represented to be a child at least 4 years younger than the person, or to arrange for another person to engage in a sexual act or sexual contact with an individual (whether real or fictitious) who is or who is represented to be a child of at least 4 years younger than the person. For the purposes of this section, arranging to engage in a sexual act or sexual contact with an individual who is fictitious shall be unlawful only if the arrangement is done by or with a law enforcement officer.
A person who violates subsection (a) of this section shall be imprisoned for not more than 5 years, fined an amount not to exceed $50,000, or both.

division.text: Criminal Law and Procedure and Prisoners.

heading.catch_text: Arranging for a sexual contact with a real or fictitious child.
